page.title: 01Longhirst Villae and Area
page.content: Longhirst is a street village of natural sanstone houses built predominantly in the early 19th century developed in the late 1800s as an estate village to service Longhirst Hall.There has been limited building early this century. It lies midway between Morpeth and Ulgham on the B1337 road in a district of mixed farmland with areas of coniferous and deciduous trees. all the farmland to the west of the village is being open cast mined for coal on a 15 year cycle finishign around 1990. The area has a population of approx 200 of whom around 50% are retired 40% commute to work while 10% work locally in agriculture or the open cast mine. The village has no shops and except for the c of e church and the sub post office all shops and other facilities are several miles away in Pegswood
